description: From Middle English aȝelden, from Old English āġieldan (“to pay, repay, render, compensate, yield, restore, reward, requite, offer oneself, offer up (as a sacrifice), perform (an office), permit, allow, pay back, punish”), equivalent to a- +‎ yield.

verbs.description: ayield (third-person singular simple present ayields, present participle ayielding, simple past ayielded or ayold, past participle ayielded or ayolden)
